answers.answer: HiRed lines on your stomach might be striae or stretch marks, which are seen when a person grows or gains weight rapidly or has certain diseases or conditions. They appear when there is rapid stretching of the skin. Striae are most commonly located on the breasts, hips, thighs, buttocks, abdomen, and flank.They are often seen after pregnancy, obese children, during puberty growth spurts in boys and girls. They may also be associated with topical corticosteroid overuse, diabetes, Cushing disease, and Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.You may try a mild steroid, such as 1% hydrocortisone, and a moisturizing lotion. They should go away by spontaneously over a period of several weeks.  If not, you should consult your doctor for evaluation.Take care
